com.slicerplugin.slicer

Class Slicer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.slicerplugin.slicer.Slicer

  • public class Slicer
extends java.lang.Object
    The slicer class; all statics methods inside. No need for instancing. This class handles the slicing, the entering in sliced mode and the exiting from it.
    Author:
    Tomas

    • Field Detail

      • slicedMode

        private static volatile boolean slicedMode
        Indicates where we are in sliced mode

      • originalText

        static java.lang.String originalText
        Original text before slice happened

      • blocks

        static volatile java.util.ArrayList<Block> blocks
        List that represent the blocks of code in the sliced file. A gap is a single line in the sliced but represent a more or less big block in the original one. Instead, a portion of code that will go in the sliced file represent another region in the original file. This is maybe the most important object of the plugin. Is used to track the changes and apply the patches back.

      • listener

        static DocumentTrackerListener listener
        Listener to track changes into the document. If in the future we'll have more documents this will be an array list

      • toHoldList

        static java.util.ArrayList<Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer>> toHoldList
        List of the lines to hold when going in sliced mode

      • slicing

        static boolean slicing
        Boolean flag to show when the thread is busy in computing a slice

      • fullPath

        static java.lang.String fullPath
        The full path of the file that is currently being sliced or in sliced mode

      • goSliceMode

        public static void goSliceMode(org.eclipse.jface.text.IDocument doc)
                        throws org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException,
                               org.eclipse.jface.text.BadLocationException
        Function called to go in sliced mode. A DocumentListenerTracker is added to track the changes and maintain associations between row. A support from the selection listener is needed to avoid changes that involved more that a marker per time (no way to handle a substitution of more than a marker in an instant for logic reasons)
        Parameters:
        doc - the doc to slice
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException - thrown if fatal internal error occurred
        org.eclipse.jface.text.BadLocationException - thrown if a location that is not in the document is referenced

      • sliceCode

        private static java.lang.String sliceCode(org.eclipse.jface.text.IDocument doc)
                                   throws org.eclipse.jface.text.BadLocationException
        Function that extract a slice from a document. It is used inside the main slice method. In brief this function create the new sliced document, and create blocks structure to track the changes
        Parameters:
        doc -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.jface.text.BadLocationException

      • unslice

        private static java.lang.String unslice()
                                 throws org.eclipse.jface.text.BadLocationException
        Unslice is called to return back from the sliced mode to the normal mode
        Returns:
        the orignal code patched with the modifications applied in sliced mode.
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.jface.text.BadLocationException

      • getSlicedMode

        public static boolean getSlicedMode()
        Returns:
        True if you are in sliced mode, false otherwise

      • containedInMarker

        public static int containedInMarker(int startLine,
                                    int endLine)
        Function that check if the selection is contained in a marker
        Parameters:
        startLine - start line of the selection
        endLine - end line of the selection
        Returns:
        return -1 if is contained, else return a row to which set the selection
